titleStmt.title: To HENRY MAYHEW,Henry Mayhew (1812-87; Dictionary of National Biography), author and reformer. Edited, with Gilbert À Beckett, the popular weekly Figaro in London; wrote plays, including The Wandering Minstrel (1834) and But However – (1838). Mayhew contributed the comic piece "Mr. Peter Punctilio, the Gentleman in Black" to Bentley's Miscellany (which CD edited) in 1838. See Harvey Peter Sucksmith, "Dickens and Mayhew: A Further Note", Nineteenth-Century Fiction 24.3 (1969): 345-9. 23 OCTOBER 1838
titleStmt.bibl: Charles Dickens Letters Project, ed. Leon Litvack, Katie Brandt, Emily Bell, and Jeremy Parrott (London: Dickens Fellowship), DickensLetters.com.

sourceDesc.p: Description in Bonhams online catalogue, June 2020.
